Package shef.mt.features.impl.bb

This package contains implementations of Blackbox features.

See: Description

  • Class Summary

    no tokens in target

    Feature1097
    coherence
    Feature1098
    number of dependencies with aligned constituents normalized by the total number of dependencies (max between source and target)
    Feature1099
    number of dependencies with aligned constituents normalized by the total number of dependencies (max between source and target), with the order of the constituents ignored
    Feature1100
    number of dependencies with well aligned constituents (Giza threshold 0.1) normalized by the total number of dependencies (max between source and target)
    Feature1101
    absolute difference between the depth of the syntactic tree for the source and the depth of the syntactic tree for the target

    number of prepositional phrases in the source
    Feature1103
    number of prepositional phrases in the target

    Feature1116
    Named Entity feature: difference in number of PERSON entities in source and target normalised by total number of person entities (max between english and arabic)
    Feature1117
    Named Entity feature: difference in number of LOCATION entities in source and target normalised by total number of person entities (max between english and arabic)
    Feature1118
    Named Entity feature: difference in number of ORGANIZATION entities in source and target normalised by total number of person entities (max between english and arabic)

    number of PERSON entities in source that are aligned to PERSON entities in target
    Feature1120
    number of LOCATION entities in source that are aligned to LOCATION entities in target
    Feature1121
    number of ORGANIZATION entities in source that are aligned to ORGANIZATION entities in target

    Named Entity feature: difference in number of PERSON entities in source and target normalised by total number of person entities (max between english and arabic)
    Feature1123
    Named Entity feature: difference in number of ORGANIZATION entities in source and target normalised by total number of person entities (max between english and arabic)
    Feature1124
    Named Entity feature: difference in number of LOCATION entities in source and target normalised by total number of person entities (max between english and arabic)
    Feature1200  
    Feature1201  
    Feature1300
    Feature 1300 is the Kullback-Leibler divergence between a source sentence and a target sentence topic distribution
    Feature1301
    Feature 1301 is the Jensen-Shannon divergence between a source sentence and a target sentence topic distribution
    Feature1302
    source sentence intra lingual mutual information
    Feature1303
    target sentence intra lingual mutual information
    Feature1304
    source-target sentence inter lingual mutual information
    Feature1400
    geometric average of target word probabilities under Global Lexicon Model The Global Lexicon Model is based on a large number of log-linear binary classifiers as suggested by Mauser et al.

    the number of words that appears in the slang dictionary

Package shef.mt.features.impl.bb Description

This package contains implementations of Blackbox features. All classes in this package extend @see wlv.mt.feature.impl.Feature
